Haryana woman held for kidnapping 6-yr-o.description: Haridwar: A 20-year-old woman from Haryana’s Sonipat was arrested on Tuesday from Haridwar railway station for allegedly kidnapping a six-year-old boy and forcing him into begging. The boy, Kunal Kumar, had gone missing on June 12 from Har-ki-Pauri, where he had come with his parents to take a dip in the Ganga. A case has been registered against the accused under section 363 (Kidnapping) and an investigation is on. During interrogation, the woman said that she had turned to begging after her husband deserted her a few months ago. After he was handed over to his parents, Kunal told police the woman had beaten him up for asking for food. SHO, city police station, Praveen Singh Koshiyari told TOI, “Rajesh Kumar, a resident of Gannor, Sonipat, Haryana had visited Haridwar with his family on June 12. After taking a dip in the Ganga, the family went to a parking lot, from where little Kunal went missing. The family then filed a missing complaint at the local police station, after which a team was formed to search for the boy.” “Our team found CCTV footage which showed the woman carrying away the boy. We approached Uttar Pradesh and Delhi police for help and finally managed to nab the woman from Haridwar railway station, where she was found begging with the boy. The accused, Varsha, is a native of Sonipat district, Haryana. She lives a nomadic life on the streets. We are investigating whether she is part of a gang.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Scuffle between tourists and civic worke.description: Mussoorie: A fight between tourists and workers of Mussoorie Municipal Council (MMC) over entry into the Mall Road led to the arrest of six people, including three MMC workers. However, soon after the arrest of their colleagues, agitated MMC workers went on strike and opened the barriers on Mall Road resulting in confusion and chaos on the Mall. The incident took place on Monday afternoon when three tourists from Meerut got into a fight with MMC workers posted at the barrier of Mall Road at Picture Palace over the entry of their vehicle into the area. The matter escalated to the extent that MMC workers along with locals started beating up the tourists, who the MMC workers alleged were under the influence of alcohol. Police initially arrested the tourists but later released them after a compromise was reached between both the parties. However, matters escalated when the police arrested three MMC workers and three other locals on charges of beating up the tourists. Soon after this, president of MMC workers’ union Mahavir Rana along with a large number of workers reached the police station and shouted slogans against the police. Rana said, “MMC workers were only doing their duty and their arrest is unjustified. The MMC workers will go on an indefinite strike.” Mussoorie station house officer (SHO) Bhawna Kainthola when queried about the issue, said that instead of beating the tourists, the MMC workers should have filed a complaint. Cabinet approves lottery system for 234.description: DEHRADUN: The Uttarakhand cabinet, which met on Wednesday, made a slight change in the excise policy and gave approval to lottery system for allocation of 234 liquor vends across the state. The revenue targets for these shops have been reduced by 35 per cent keeping in mind that just about nine months are left in the ongoing financial year. These vends were not allotted at the start of the ongoing fiscal, following which the cabinet has now decided to revamp the target. Sources said that the lottery system has been chosen so that all the shops could be allotted. The cabinet also observed a two-minute silence to pay tribute to former minister Prakash Pant. A decision was taken to name the 5-km-long two-way lane from Jolly Grant to Bhuniya temple in Thano after Pant, who passed away on June 5 this year. The cabinet also approved the claiming of Rs 65 crore from the Centre as arrears of seventh pay commission for teachers of government degree colleges and government aided colleges. The arrears were from January 1, 2016, to March 31, 2019. The finance department informed the cabinet that the Centre’s share of arrear of sixth pay commission, too, had not been cleared for the teachers. Following which, the cabinet directed the finance department to start the proceedings. Under the pay commission, 50 per cent of the arrear is to be given by the state while remaining 50 per cent by the Centre. In another decision, the cabinet cdecided to include the Indian Coast Guard in the list of paramilitary forces, in which dependents of martyrs were given government jobs in the state on compassionate grounds. Earlier the benefits of reservation in Group C jobs were given to servicemen, paramilitary personnel and state employees posted outside and their children. Making a slight change in the recruitment policy for Group C, the state government has included the wives of all such defence, paramilitary and state employees serving outside the state. It was also informed that a two-day assembly session would be held in Dehradun from June 24. A few ordinances are likely to be tabled in the assembly and parliamentary work carried out in the two-day proceedings.For the committee to monitor print advertisement content in media the state government has made some changes in the policy. The eight registered organisations of the journalists would be asked to send three names each. Following which, four names would be announced as members, whereas the remaining four non-journalist members of the committee would be declared by the CM. The work tenure for each member would be of two years but may be terminated by the Information and Broadcasting minister on basis of their performance. Ramdas Athawale.description: NEW DELHI: Union minister and Republican Party of India leader Ramdas Athawale on Wednesday left members of the Lok Sabha, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in peels of laughter with his witty remarks, some aimed at Congress president Rahul Gandhi. In his congratulatory remarks after the unanimous election of Om Birla as Lok Sabha Speaker, Athawale, who has a knack for spontaneous humour, said he is happy that Rahul got a chance to sit in Lok Sabha though as an opposition member. While Rahul won from Wayanad in Kerala, he lost the Gandhi stronghold of Amethi in Uttar Pradesh to Smriti Irani. #WATCH:Ramdas Athawale in Lok Sabha says,"Rahul ji aapko wahan baithne ka mauka mila isiliye aapko badhai deta hoon… https://t.co/cRPL9IbuWV— ANI (@ANI) 1560939466000"Rahul ji aapko wahan baithne ka mauka mila isiliye aapko badhai deta hoon. Jab apki satta thi tab main aapke saath tha. Chunav ke pehle mujhe Congress wale bol rahe the idhar aao. Maine hawa ka rukh dekha ki woh Modi ji ki taraf ja rahi hai (I congratulate you on getting an opportunity to sit there (in the Opposition benches). I was with the UPA when it was in power. Congress leaders asked me to join them again ahead of elections. But I saw which way the wind was blowing and decided to remain with NDA," he said. Rahul and Sonia took his remarks sportingly and were seen smiling. When the RPI leader was speaking, Modi was seen laughing on more than two occasions. "Now, our government will run for five years, and for another five years ... Modi sahib will continue to do the good work. We will not let you come this side (treasury benches) so easily," Athawale said, amid thumping of desks by NDA members. Read this story in MarathiIn Video:Ramdas Athawale takes a dig at Rahul Gandhi in Lok Sabha, evokes laughterDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Mussoorie: Garbage collection worst hit.description: MUSSOORIE: An indefinite strike launched by workers of Mussoorie Municipal Corporation (MMC) on Monday evening threw life out of gear in the tourist town. While both barriers of Mall Road remained unmanned on the second consecutive day, garbage collection and disposal were the worst hit at the peak of the tourist season. Although the door-to-door collection of garbage has been handed over to a private agency, the cleaning of roads and picking up of garbage from Mall Road are done by civic body workers. Shalabh Garg, a local resident, said, “The Mall Road was not cleaned and brimming garbage bins caused much inconvenience.” Another resident said, “The MMC workers beat up tourists and if action is taken against them, why should they go on strike and hold the town at ransom?” MMC workers also took out a protest march on Mall Road and demanded that the station officer of Mussoorie be transferred. “We have submitted a memorandum to the sub-divisional magistrate as well as to the SSP demanding transfer of the SHO,” said Mahavir Singh Rana, president of MMC Workers’ Union. As the arrested MMC workers were given bail around Tuesday afternoon, the strike was called off later in the day after talks with police officers. The MMC workers went on strike after a fight between tourists and workers present at the entry barrier on Mall Road. Six people had been arrested after the scuffle including three tourists. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Mob attacks doctor over allegations of m.description: UTTARKASHI: A doctor at a primary health centre in Dhauntri village of Dunda block in Uttarkashi district was beaten up by villagers after a local woman accused him of molestation. An FIR was filed on Wednesday against the doctor, who said the allegations were baseless. The local medical association expressed its resentment, saying a mob attacking a doctor without looking into an issue first was demoralizing for physicians. According to sources, the doctor managed to save himself from the violent mob by locking himself in a medical store. Later, the district magistrate and other senior officials reached the spot and rescued him. The woman on Wednesday filed a complaint against the doctor with the revenue police. Dismissing all allegations against him, the doctor said, “A few days ago, some tourists approached me, requesting me to help them find a cheap hotel. I suggested them a local hotel. The woman who accused me of molestation also runs a hotel along with her husband, and was upset that I didn’t recommend her hotel. She first abused and thrashed me. Later, she leveled baseless allegations against me and incited a mob to attack me. I will file a complaint against her, as she tried to ruin my image.” Dr SP Kudiyal, district president of a local medical association said, “It is worrying that a mob attacked a doctor without verifying if the issue was real. This incident will affect the morale of doctors, who are working in the hills, despite various challenges. We have called a meeting of all doctors before taking any further action.” Prem Singh Makhloga, the revenue officer said, “We have filed a complaint against the doctor under sections 323 (punishment for voluntarily causing hurt), 352 (punishment for assault or criminal force otherwise than on grave provocation), 354 (assault or criminal force to woman with intent to outrage her modesty), 504 (intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace) and 506 (punishment for criminal intimidation) of the IPC. We are investigating the issue before taking any action against him.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Monsoon weeks away, DMC yet to desilt Ri.description: DEHRADUN: With the monsoon less than two weeks away, the Dehradun Municipal Corporation’s plan to desilt Rispana and Bindal rivers is yet to take off. The cleaning drive, which was to start late last month, is yet to make any significant progress, even though pre-monsoon rains have already hit the state. Mayor Sunil Uniyal Gama had announced last month that silt in the rivers will be cleared before the onset of monsoon, to ensure smooth flow of rainwater. Gama had also said that an amount of Rs 50 lakh will be disbursed by DMC for the purpose and had held a meeting with district magistrate and MDDA vice-president about it. While some DMC officials said the cleaning process had started only a few days back and was unlikely to be finished before monsoon, others said it hadn’t started in earnest yet. DMC health officer RK Singh said, “We have started cleaning the rivers. In fact, just a few days back, we held a drive near Kargi Chowk. We aim to finish the cleaning as soon as possible.” Another senior official, who didn’t wish to be named, said, “Though the announcement was made last month, we are yet to start desilting the rivers. We need to issue tenders for the purpose, which hasn’t started yet.” Residents said the silt in the river has caused the riverbed to rise. “The river has not been cleaned properly for years, which caused silt to deposit on the riverbed. It has risen over the years, and now the river overflows easily and water enters low-lying areas, creating a flood-like situation,” said Rajkumar Tiwari, a resident of Kanwli Road. Photos: Corbett plans to open Ramganga f.description: NAINITAL: The picturesque Ramganga waterways, which was famously used by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in February this year during his visit to the Corbett Tiger Reserve (CTR), is again in the news as the CTR administration is now proposing to open the Ramganga — which flows through dense forests — for water tourism. In addition, there are also plans to create a new zone in CTR, apart from the six that already exist, in order to ease the pressure on the core area of the sanctuary which sees increased tourist activity. Speaking about the proposed water tourism project, Sanjiv Chaturvedi, officiating director of the reserve, said, “The plan is to look for alternatives to tiger-centric tourism and generate significant local revenue. It can be operated throughout the year, except for three months of the monsoon.” The CTR administration is initially planning to use three motor boats for a 45-minute ride on the river, for which Rs 2000 would be charged per tourist. The boats will primarily ply on the water body created by construction of a dam on the Ramganga river between 1962-70. The water body spans an area of around 8142 hectares. Chaturvedi said that a proposal regarding the project, which is expected to cost around Rs 10 lakh, has been sent to senior officials of the forest department. He added that a study has also been proposed to help in deciding the magnitude of tourism activity that can be undertaken without any adverse effects on the ecology of the area. The other proposal put forward by the park administration includes opening up a new zone for tourism. This zone is proposed by the name of 'Ringoda Tourism Zone' which will have parts of Amdanda, Bijrani, Sarpudali and Garjia areas of the park. The project cost is estimated at Rs 45.05 lakh. The officiating director said that the grasslands and adjacent forests in the proposed zone have all the wildlife including tigers, elephants and others which are found in Dhikala zone of the CTR, which is one of the most popular zones among tourists. "The biodiversity of the area is rich and safaris of four hours will be as good an experience for tourists as the Dhikala or Bijrani zone,” said Chaturvedi. The entire area is in buffer zone of the reserve which will enable lessening of burden from the core area of the protected sanctuary, he added. Incidentally, the last time a new zone was opened in CTR was six years ago. The National Tiger Conservation Authority in its TCP (Tiger Conservation Plan) has already recommended the opening of a new zone. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. Almora records negative population growt.description: HARIDWAR: Migration from Almora has outpaced the population growth in the district, revealed a report unveiled at the second annual general meeting of state's Rural and Migration commission on Monday, which was attended by chief minister Trivendra Singh Rawat. The report brings out the migration menace of the district to the fore pointing out that Almora witnessed a negative population growth (-1.64%) during 2001-2011. The summary of the report, a copy of which is with TOI, reads, “In the last ten years, a total of 53, 611 persons from 1022 gram panchayats have migrated on a semi-permanent basis, though they come to their homes in the villages from time to time and have not migrated permanently.” The report further reveals that the total rural population of the district dipped by 4.20% during the period. The report cited the lack of agricultural lands in the district as one of the major reasons behind the migration. Notably, only 7-to-8 percent of the district’s land area is fit for agriculture. Meanwhile, taking cognizance of the issue of migration, especially from hilly areas, CM Rawat tasked the commission to analyse the migration patterns in Tehri and Pithoragarh as well. BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP may elect new state president soon.description: DEHRADUN: With the appointment of former union health minister JP Nadda as the new BJP chief, the party’s state unit is also likely to get a new party president soon. Sources said that the party’s current state president Ajay Bhatt, who was elected the MP from Nainital in the recently-held elections, will vacate the state chief post soon after the new incumbent comes. “The post of party’s state president is a full-time job and thus managing this position along with a constituency is not possible. Hence, the party will soon elect the new state president,” said a BJP leader . Notably, after Bhatt was nominated to contest from Nainital seat against Congress’s Harish Rawat, BJP had appointed its state’s joint secretary Naresh Bansal as party’s interim state president. Six arrested in Rs 33 Lakh petrol pump r.description: ROORKEE: Manglaur police on Tuesday arrested six persons in connection with robbery at a local petrol pump on NH-58 on June 10. One of the accused turned out to be an employee of the petrol pump. Two employees of the petrol pump, who were on their way to deposit Rs 33 lakh in a bank in Roorkee, were robbed of the cash on their way there. The accused held the victims at gunpoint and snatched the money after throwing chilli powder in their eyes. The accused were identified as Rakesh Pal, 35, Jitender, 27, Veer Singh, 27, Ramvir Singh, 25, Sunil Kumar Sonu, 30 and Anuj Kumar, 24. While the first four persons are from Milap Nagar locality the remaining duo are residents of Mohanpura locality. Veer Singh and Ramvir Singh are siblings. Anuj was an employee of the filling station. On June 10, Amir Ahmed and Pawan Chauhan, both employees of Reliance petrol pump, were on their way to deposit Rs 33,56,000 cash in a bank when their bike was intercepted by the accused around 12 pm. The miscreants, who were on two bikes, brandished a gun and threw chilli powder at the petrol pump employees before fleeing with the loot. According to Haridwar SSP Janmaijai Prabhakar Khanduri, Rakesh Pal, a gang leader, along with Jitendra and Veer Singh, hatched the plan to rob the petrol pump last month. Police have recovered Rs 23,05,000 from the accused. They said efforts were on to recover the rest of the amount from the accused. Lalit Mohan Agarwal, owner of petrol pump, said, “Manglaur police, led by inspector Pradeep Chauhan and special operation group (SOG) team have done a remarkable job in quickly solving the case.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Narendra Modi.description: NEW DELHI: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said a committee will be set up to explore the possibility of holding simultaneous Lok Sabha and assembly polls even as several opposition parties kept away from a meeting he had called to discuss the "One Nation, One Election" proposal. Defence minister Rajnath Singh said the discussions attended by 21 of the 40 parties represented in Parliament - with three more sending written submissions - saw most parties favouring the proposal even as he added that the PM said a decision will be taken by consensus. The meeting saw key absentees such as Congress, Trinamool, BSP, DMK, SP, TDP and AAP. Left parties attended the discussions, but CPM leader Sitaram Yechury said the party felt the move was "anti-federal" and did not support it and it went against accountability of governments. CPI leader D Raja said the proposal was "impractical and unconstitutional" and would need major constitutional changes. Leaders who attended the meeting included NCP leader Sharad Pawar, CPI's D Raja, Bihar chief minister and JD (U) leader Nitish Kumar, SAD leader Sukhbir Singh Badal, Odisha chief minister and BJD leader Naveen Patnaik and National People's Party leader Conrad Sangma. PDP leader Mehbooba Mufti and National Conference's Farooq Abdullah also attended the meeting. Pawar is understood to have said the proposal would take time to implement and was not a simple matter. Mehbooba and Abdullah are also understood to have pointed out problems in ensuring simultaneous assembly and Lok Sabha polls. BJP ally Shiv Sena was absent as Wednesday was the Foundation Day of the party with a function organised in Mumbai. Among important non-NDA leaders, Patnaik supported the proposal as did YSR Congress's Jaganmohan Reddy. TRS was represented by K Chandrasekhar Rao's son KT Rama Rao, who said the proposal needs more detailed examination before a decision can be arrived at. "The PM will form the committee to look into possibilities of simultaneous polls. Exact nature of the committee will be made public later," Singh told the media. He said the committee will give its suggestions on the subject in a time-bound manner and quoted the PM as saying that "One Nation, One Election" was not an agenda of any party but of the nation and that political parties should consider the larger interest of the country. Modi said all parties will be taken into confidence before taking a final decision and differences of opinion will be taken into account with full seriousness. "Most parties gave their support, CPI(M) and CPI had a difference of opinion but they didn't oppose the idea, just the implementation of it," Singh claimed. "We had invited 40 political parties, out of which 21 parties participated and three other parties sent their opinion on the subjects in writing." BSP chief Mayawati tweeted on Tuesday morning saying she would have attended the all-party meeting if it was on electronic voting machines (EVMs). Besides simultaneous polls, the PM had invited heads of political parties to discuss several issues, including celebration of 75 years of Independence in 2022 and 150th birth anniversary celebrations of Mahatma Gandhi this year. Last August, the Law Commission recommended simultaneous elections to Lok Sabha and state assemblies to save public money. The draft said, "Holding simultaneous elections is not possible within the existing framework of the Constitution." The panel recommended amendments to the Constitution and the Representation of the People Act to ensure simultaneous elections. The law panel as well as a group of senior officials set up by Modi in his first term had suggested that elections can be synchronised in two phases. The next Lok Sabha election could see states due to go to polls within six months before or after national polls brought together. The remainder states could be brought into the fold in the subsequent the Lok Sabha polls. Lack of consensus ensured the proposal never got off the ground. It now appears that Modi is using his fresh majority to give the proposal another strong push by kick-starting a discussion. 140 transformer thefts in Roorkee.description: ROORKEE: The case of transformers being stolen in Roorkee is reportedly on the rise. In the last 14 months, over 140 cases of transformer theft have been reported in the district which has resulted in a loss of Rs 2.5 crore, local electricity department sources s aid. The electricity department has alleged that the police were inactive in locating the gangs that are involved in the crime. “Due to these thefts, we have incurred a loss of Rs 2.5 crore. Moreover, the police have not acted against the criminals,” said Amit Kumar Sharma, deputy general manager of Uttarakhand Power Corporation Limited, Roorkee. Police, however, have said that they have taken action and even made a few arrests. “We arrest them from time to time, but we have been unable to recover the stolen transformers, as they are sold in the market,” said Pramod Kumar, a senior sub-inspector at Civil Lines police station. 140 transformer thefts in Roorkee Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Country gets 42 state forest officers.description: Haridwar: The Central Academy for State Forest Service (CASFoS) held convocation for 2017-19 batch of State Forest Service Officer Trainees on Tuesday which saw 42 officer trainees graduating from the institute. The cadets, comprising 11 lady officer trainees, hailed from several states including Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Manipur, Nagaland, Odisha, Uttar Pradesh and Tamil Nadu. While delivering the convocation address, Madan Kaushik, Uttarakhand’s minister of urban development and housing, stressed upon the crucial role which the cadets will play as future custodians of the country’s rich forest wealth. “These officers are entering the service at a time when the sector is facing multiple challenges and requires great skill and devotion to rise to the expectation of their countrymen,” Kaushik said. Five trainee officers were rewarded special awards for their meritorious performance. Notably, cadets from Uttar Pradesh bagged maximum awards for best performance. While 21 officers were given honours diploma certificate, the others were given diploma certificates. Event’s guest of honour and director of Indira Gandhi National Forest Academy Omkar Singh reminded the young officers of India’s commitment towards conserving environment in Paris agreement. “You all have to focus on increasing the carbon sink of country to meet the Paris agreement. The challenge is to have quality forest and conserve our precious forest wealth,” said Singh. Senior forest officers, heads of departments, other officers and scientists from leading organisations/institutions in and around Dehradun were also present at the convocation. VHP\u2019s body of patrons hopes Modi go.description: Haridwar: Vishwa Hindu Parishad’s margdarshak mandal (seers’ body of patrons) at its meeting held in Haridwar on Monday reminded the Narendra Modi government of the promises the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) made in its manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls 2019. These included implementation of a uniform population policy, removing Articles 370 and 35 A of the Constitution, rehabilitation of Kashmiri pundits in the Valley and delimitation of Jammu & Kashmir assembly constituencies afresh to make the state politics reflective of its people’s sentiments, according to the seers. They added that removing all obstacles in the way to build a Ram temple at Ayodhya was another pledge in the manifesto. “With the Modi government returning to power with a massive mandate, immediate steps should be initiated to fulfil them”, the margdarshak mandal demanded, said Vijai Shankar Tiwari, VHP’s national spokesperson. The seers exuded confidence that the government’s measures taken to fulfil its various commitments will get peoples’ support, he added. Over 200 seers from across the country are taking part in the two-day meeting of the right-wing outfit that was held at Akhand Param Dham ashram. VHP president Vishnu Sadashiv Kokaje spoke in detail about Article 370 and 35 A. Deliberations were held on various issues in the country, Tiwari added. The margadarshak mandal felicitated Modi on his government’s convincing victory, ascribing it mainly to the government’s focus on nationalism, Hindutva and development, besides its numerous welfare acts. The peoples’ mandate also had to do with the various resolves the government expressed during the election campaign.The margadarshak mandal felicitated Modi on his government’s convincing victory, ascribing it mainly to the government’s focus on nationalism, Hindutva and development, besides its numerous welfare acts. The peoples’ mandate also had to do with the various resolves the government expressed during the election campaign.VHP’s general secretary Milind Parande said that the Ram temple issue will come up for a detailed discussion soon and a resolution on it is likely to be adopted. Rain brings relief from forest fires.description: Haridwar: Rains not only brought relief from the scorching heat but also reduced the number of forest fire incidents across the state on Monday. Barely nine incidents of forest fires were recorded in the state, the highest from Uttarkashi (5), followed by two each in Dehradun and Pauri districts. These incidents were recorded in the morning. However, post afternoon, rain lashed the state easing the situation for foresters. A total 14 hectares of forest cover was under the grip of wildfires. Around 2,115 wildfires have gutted 2,935 hectares of forest cover causing a loss of Rs 54.92 lakh to Uttarakhand. A total of 1,193 wildfire incidents from Kumaon and 841 from Garhwal have been recorded till date. Pramod Kumar, conservator of forest fires of the Uttarakhand forest department, said, “We are nearing an end to the forest fire season. In the morning, around five incidents were reported from Uttarkashi but all were minor and controlled in time.” On Sunday, due to sporadic instances of rain, forest department had announced that the forthcoming days would be fire-neutral due to pleasant weather. Incidentally, no fire incident was reported in the state on Sunday.. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Public transport facility crisis in hill.description: Uttarkashi/Dehradun: Home to the four shrines — Gangotri, Yamunotri, Kedarnath and Badrinath — of the Char Dham circuit, the Garhwal region of the hill state is currently witnessing a heavy influx of pilgrims due to the ongoing Yatra season. And as almost 80% of the public transport vehicles are pressed into service on the Char Dham route, lack of commuting options has left locals of the region in a lurch. The transport crisis comes despite 2,500 registered taxis plying in the Garhwal region. Speaking to TOI, Harikrishna Kanswal, Garhwal taxi union president, said, “It is rather difficult for the taxi drivers to manage their expenses within the lean earnings they make from transporting locals. The pilgrimage season helps the taxi drivers earn a decent living which is why taxi operators are keen on plying on the Char Dham Yatra route.” Among all the districts of the division, Uttarkashi, where the Gangotri and Yamunotri shrines are located, is the worst impacted as only 300 taxis are currently plying on the intra-city routes. “We have around 1450 taxis in the district but 1150 out of them are plying on the Char Dham Yatra route. The remaining 300 taxis are not sufficient to fulfill the transportation requirements of the district,” Arjun Bhandari, president, district taxi union, told TOI. Similar is the case with public buses in the district. “At present, 35 out of the total 62 public buses are operating on the Char Dham Yatra route and the remaining 27 are plying on other routes of Uttarkashi district. Due to this, we are not able to provide bus services in areas like Gorsali, Barsu and Bangaun. Also, we have not been able to provide bus services in Assi Ganga valley region and a few other routes due to lack of enough passengers and poor condition of roads,” Gajpal Rawat, president of Tehri Garhwal motor owners union, told TOI.  Locals say that this situation is not new. “It happens quite often. Most of the taxis which are the only mode of transport for many of us get involved in the yatra and we are stuck,” said Ajay Bisht, a resident of Pauri Garhwal district. When queried, Chakrapani Mishra, ARTO Uttarkashi, told TOI, “Difficult terrain has been among the major causes behind the transportation woes, especially in hilly areas. There is a need to look beyond traditional modes of transportation to check the issue.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

HC accepts Ramdev aide\u2019s plea for p.description: NAINITAL: Uttarakhand High Court on Wednesday accepted a clarification application regarding the renewal period of passport of Acharya Balkrishna, a close aide of Ramdev. “The honorable court by this enabled the renewal of the passport for maximum possible period according to law,” said Ajay Veer Pundir, counsel of Balkrishna in the case. In July 2018, in a relief to Balkrishna, the CEO of Patanjali Ayurved, the HC gave directions to release his passport, impounded in 2011. The reprieve, however, came with a rider as the HC had added that if the passport authorities deem it fit, they can put a condition or get a bond signed from Balkrishna under which he will have to pledge to return to the country. The court did not specify any time period for renewal. So, the authorities renewed the passport only for a year. Following this, an application was filed by him in the court requesting clarification in the matter. It all dates back to 2011 when a case of forging documents to procure passport was lodged against Balkrishna. In 2012, he was arrested by the CBI after a non-bailable warrant was issued against him by the trial court. The allegations were that Balkrishna submitted fake educational certificates in order to procure passport for himself. The CBI had built the case on the basis of evidence collected during the investigation that reportedly includes fake educational documents in violation of section 12 of Indian Passport Act. The agency checked all the records from the universities mentioned by Balkrishna but did not find anything to establish that degrees mentioned by Ramdev’s aide were awarded to him. Cross-checking Balkrishna’s two degrees ‘Purv Madhyma’ and ‘Shastri’ which he claimed as his, the CBI found the enrolment numbers mentioned in them did not match. The investigative agency then filed a chargesheet against Balkrishna in a case of forging documents to procure a passport for which a trial is going on in a lower court in Dehradun. Devoid of even basic civic amenities, al.description: Dehradun: Garbage strewn across empty plots, stray cattle roaming around the streets, and broken pipelines spewing hundreds of liters of water every day are a common sight in the Balbir Road area, listed among the posh localities of the city. The road, which connects Araghar Chowk to Nehru Colony, spans across ward 29 and 30 and is lined up with multi-story commercial complexes and residences on both sides. The residents, however, allege that they are devoid of even the basic civic amenities. “Dehradun Municipal Corporation (DMC) must ensure proper waste management in the city but they are unwilling to take responsibility. It has been months since the contract for door-to-door collection of garbage was given to a new company but our ward hasn’t received the services as yet. The roads and empty plots are littered with trash and now that the monsoons are approaching, diseases will spread easily and the smell would be intolerable. Even the stray dogs create nuisance and it must be made sure that they don’t loiter on the streets,” Ankita Negi, a resident of Balbir Road told TOI. Residents of ward 29 also allege differential treatment by the civic body claiming that ward 30 residents are provided with all facilities but authorities overlook ward 29. “Ward 30 is taken care of by the authorities but seems like ward 29 isn’t on their priority list. Due to absence of a door-to-door garbage collection service in ward 29, many throw their trash on the road making the surroundings unhygienic,” Sateh Singh Negi, a ward 29 resident, told TOI. The residents also claim that they reached out to the municipal corporation but their complaints were snubbed by the civic body. “Despite BJP office being located at a short distance, the area remains a mess. Situations like this make you wonder if the government offices have become dysfunctional. If the garbage menace is so bad in the suburbs, one can imagine the state of remote areas,” Shashi Chaurasia, another resident of ward 29, told TOI. Meanwhile, DMC officials have claimed that door-to-door garbage collection is picking up in the city and it will soon be implemented in every area. “We are not certain of the situation in the Balbir Road area but now that door-to-door garbage collection has finally started, it will soon reach every corner of the city. We have bought new vehicles and the process to hire workers is underway. The issues will be addressed soon,” said DMC’s chief health officer, Kailash Joshi. A year since demolition drive, encroachm.description: DEHRADUN: A year after the high court’s order to clear Dehradun of encroachment led to thousands of illegal structures being demolished, the condition of a few major areas still remains unchanged with encroachments continuing. “Authorities came and marked the shops and homes for demolition. However, even a year later, the structures stand as the drive was deferred. Now many people have in fact painted over the markings and are continuing to occupy the government land,” said Rajesh Kumar, a resident of Chakrata Road. Government figures suggest that over 10,000 illegal structures were identified in the city but only half of them could be demolished under the drive which continued for a few months. This means that over 5,000 structures across the city, even though officially identified as encroachments, are still standing. What makes matters worse is that the drive which officials said will resume soon has simply been put on hold. Also, no plan has been put in place post the demolitions. “Hundreds of establishments were demolished. But, they had no post-demolition plan. You can still see a number of structures lying in ruins because locals fear that the drive can start any moment,” said Janki Devi, a resident of Raipur. Another resident said that though the authorities demolished shops and other establishments lining the major roads, they are yet to rebuild the roads or even shift the utility lines and electric poles. “If you travel to the sports college in Raipur, you will see that electric poles and transformers still stand in the middle of the road because they could not shift them to the sides. In fact, at many locations they did not even build the roads and rubble can be seen lying along the sidewalks,” said Mandeep Rajawat, a resident of Jakhan. Officials however say that construction work in the areas where demolition was done is on and will be finished soon. “We have made plans for construction of roads and shifting of electric poles and lines to the sides. While the work has started and even finished at many locations, those left will also be undertaken soon,” said Om Prakash, additional chief secretary. BJP Candidate List.description: NEW DELHI: Amid rumblings over ticket denials in some seats like Kanpur, where saffron veteran   Murli Manohar Joshi has been benched   , and Bangalore South, where the wife of late party leader Ananth Kumar was overlooked for a young debutant, BJP issued on Tuesday a list of 43 nominees for the Lok Sabha polls. Not budging in the face of Joshi’s stiff resistance to being asked to step aside, BJP announced Satyadev Pachauri, a minister in the UP cabinet, as the replacement for the octogenarian leader. The list of 30 candidates for UP, however, accommodated women and child welfare minister Maneka Gandhi and her son Varun Gandhi, who were allowed to swap their Pilibhit and Sultanpur seats. Other interesting picks include   actor-politician Jaya Prada   , who was named against SP leader Azam Khan from Rampur in UP soon after she joined BJP. The selection ignites an old and bitter rivalry, as the former Bollywood star is close to former SP leader Amar Singh who has scores to settle with SP and Khan. Another UP cabinet minister, Rita Bahuguna Joshi, a former UP Congress chief who joined BJP, will contest from the prestigious constituency of Allahabad, where the sitting party MP, Shyama Charab Gupta, has left for SP and is contesting from Banda. She is the daughter of the late H N Bahuguna, a former UP chief minister and well-known Congress leader. Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, the party’s candidate from Patna Sahib, faced protests when he landed in Patna on Tuesday. The protesters claimed loyalty to BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP R K Sinha, who was later pulled up by the party while sources said the heckling was led by a person identified as an expelled BJP member. Varun Gandhi, who has had his ups and downs in BJP, was on the list of nominees and will stake his claim for Pilibhit, which has been a family bastion. Maneka Gandhi will be pitted in a triangular contest against SP-BSP alliance candidate Chandrabhanu Singh, alias Sonu Singh, a local politician with clout among Rajput voters who could have turned up the heat for Varun. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh is in the fray as the Congress nominee. Joshi, a former BJP president, made no secret of his displeasure at being denied a ticket and went public by releasing a letter addressed to voters of Kanpur saying he received a call from party general secretary (organisation) Ramlal asking him not to contest the polls. Joshi, 85, has been asked not to contest just as it was decided that 91-year-old party patriarch L K Advani will not fight from Gandhinagar. Joshi’s defiant note was possibly the reason behind the nomination of a Brahmin face as another UP state minister, Satish Mahana, had been talked of as the frontrunner to replace the veteran leader The party decision is in line with several veterans not being nominated to pave way for younger leaders. The 2019 election will see the curtain drop on the electoral politics of what was seen the Vajpayee-Advani era in the party. BJP has also not given tickets to B C Khanduri, Karia Munda, Kalraj Mishra, Bijoya Chakravarty — all MPs for several terms and over 80 years of age. BJP sprang a surprise by giving 28-year-old Tejaswi Surya, an advocate and Karnataka Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha general secretary, the ticket from Bangalore South, belying expectations that Tejaswini Ananth Kumar would be its choice for the constituency her husband represented six times. The choice triggered strong protests and even state BJP president B S Yeddyurappa said they had sent only Tejaswini’s name, which, he claimed, was changed in Delhi. Tejaswini had to issue statements to mollify her supporters as she said the polls were about re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister. BJP has announced 349 candidates, including 62 in UP, so far. Two seats in UP have been left for alliance partner Apna Dal (Sonelal). Party president Amit Shah will decide the remaining 16 seats in UP where sitting MPs are likely to be replaced, and a reason behind delaying the announcement is to reduce prospects of dissidence and rebellion. The party has so far dropped 14 sitting MPs in UP. BJP general secretary Arun Singh announced that Union minister Manoj Sinha has been fielded from Ghazipur, a seat he had won in 2014. BJP’s Kisan Morcha chief Birendra Singh Mast has been shifted from his sitting seat Bhadohi to far-east Ballia in UP, replacing sitting MP Bharat Singh, whose poor performance was a concern for the party. Agra MP Ram Shankar Katheria, head of the SC commission who had been denied renomination from the current seat, has been moved to Etawah (SC), replacing Ashok Kumar Dohray. UP BJP president Mahendra Nath Pandey has been repeated from Chandauli. In Video:No Murli Manohar Joshi in BJP list of 43Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Swami Darshan Bharti\u2019s bail plea sc.description: DEHRAUDUN: A day after a local court in Rudraprayag rejected the bail plea of Uttarakhand Raksha Abhiyan patron Swami Darshan Bharti, the organization, on Tuesday, threatened a state-wide agitation. Bharti is accused of uploading a social media post provoking communal disharmony over a case in which a girl was harassed by a youth of another community in Agastmuni in April 2018. Bharti’s post allegedly led to torching and looting of the establishments belonging to the people from accused’s community. The decision, however, did not go down well with Bharti’s supporters and members of the Uttarakhand Raksha Abhiyan who have threatened an agitation accusing the state and the central government of acting against the ‘foot soldiers of Hindutva’. Harikrishan Kimoti, convenor, Uttarakhan Raksha Abhiyan told TOI that the group has circulated over 1.5 lakh pamphlets, a copy of which is with TOI, exhorting the majority to stand up against minorities whose population has skyrocketed in the state. Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Photos: Court bans chopper sorties at Gu.description: NAINITAL: Uttarakhand high court (HC) while hearing a public interest litigation (PIL) regarding the high-profile wedding of South Africa’s Gupta family at Auli in the Garhwal Himalayas, prevented operating of helicopter services and construction of helipad at the venue. The order, issued by the division bench of chief justice Ramesh Ranganathan and justice Alok Kumar Verma, said, “If as contended on behalf of the petitioner, there is no helipad at Auli, and prior to this event, helicopter services were not provided to the said place, the private respondents shall neither construct a helipad nor extend helicopter services to such places as that would have an adverse impact on the environment.” The judges however allowed the family “to use the nearest helipad after obtaining the requisite permission from the authorities concerned.” The construction site in Auli where the wedding will be heldEarlier, during deliberations, the judges came down heavily on the state government saying that the first responsibility of the government is the state and not 'some rich businessman from South Africa'. They also directed the state government to ensure that “these mindless pursuits of holding large-scale marriage celebrations at exotic locations, and at such places where such mega-events have never been conducted earlier, do not result in irreparable environmental degradation of the said area.” The bench while hearing the petition also added that Uttarakhand is the only state which will ecologically save the country. "We will not permit you to destroy Uttarakhand," the bench said. The judges also questioned the reason for the choice of venue and asked if there was not anywhere else to host the wedding considering that “these people reside in South Africa and Dubai.” "Once the damage is caused, it will be irreversible," said the bench. The judges also questioned the reason for the choice of venue and asked if there was not anywhere else to host the weddingThe court also directed the state pollution control board to monitor the events of the wedding constantly till the conclusion of the functions in order to check “from all angles the damage to environment and ecology of the area.” The court had initially asked for a security amount of Rs 5 crore to be deposited but the counsel for the Gupta brothers requested to reduce the amount to Rs 2 crore after which the court said that the final amount will be decided at the next hearing on Tuesday when an assessment of the likely environmental damage caused due to the wedding celebrations is submitted by the state pollution control board. While passing the order, the court noted that calling off the marriage at this stage may result in "irreparable injury" to the family. "While it is debatable whether the authorities are justified in granting such permissions, interdiction by this court at this belated stage when the events are scheduled to commence today i.e. 17.06.2019, may result in the marriage being called off, causing irreparable injury to families concerned. While that, by itself, may not justify the private respondents being permitted to damage the sensitive ecology of the upper Himalayas, where Auli is situated, the least that must be done is to minimize any adverse effect which this large-scale event may have on the fragile ecosystem at Auli," said the court. The judges further asked the state government to clarify by Tuesday whether the venue of the marriage is a bugyal (meadow) in order to determine whether it would be covered by an order of a division bench of the HC last year. The bench had prohibited camping activities in all bugyals across the state. The petitioner, Rakshit Joshi, a resident of Kashipur in Udham Singh Nagar district had in his petition stated that “tents were being set up in the eco-sensitive region, and such a high-profile wedding will generate tonnes of garbage causing much damage to the environment.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Woman kills dad as he tries to rape her.description: UTTARKASHI: A woman allegedly murdered her father in Uttarkashi district on Monday night after he tried to rape her in an inebriated condition.  The incident came to light on Tuesday when locals found the body of the father. On information, revenue police rushed to the spot and arrested the woman. They also recovered the murder weapon from her. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Now, plant a sapling in memory of a love.description: Haridwar: Now, pilgrims visiting Uttarakhand can plant a sapling in memory of their loved one and also see the tree grow using a mobile app. The state forest department has also earmarked for the project specified forest areas which are being developed as ‘Smriti Van’ (Forest of memories). The initiative was kickstarted at Haridwar on Sunday by Garhwal commissioner Basava Purushottam. Foundation stones were also laid for the project at Digoli van panchayat in Chamoli, Batola on the Rishikesh-Badrinath national highway, Rishikesh-Haridwar bypass in Dehradun, horticulture farm in Uttarkashi and Ratura in Rudraprayag. Speaking to TOI, Purushottam said that local villagers are being taken into the loop to ensure that the saplings are cared for properly.“The self-help groups of the respective Ganga grams (villages located along river Ganga) and van panchayats would ensure that the planted saplings are guarded well and their maintenance, watering and online updating of latest pictures in the app is done in a timely manner.” he added. Terming the initiative as “a unique way in which people can pay homage to their ancestors and deceased loved ones”, tourism minister Satpal Maharaj said, “Uttarakhand is Dev Boomi and people come here for spiritual salvation. Smriti Van will be one more opportunity and a unique way to pay tribute to departed souls.” He added that he has also shared a plan with the state government to make a separate 'Smriti Van' at Kedarnath in the memory of the 2013 disaster victims. In Haridwar, the Ganga Vatika in Kankhal and Khadkadi area have been chosen for creating the ‘Forest of memories’. Speaking to TOI, district magistrate of Haridwar Deepak Rawat said that “cremation committees are being asked to promote the environment-friendly cause by motivating those who visit Haridwar for cremation and related activities.” Incidentally, each sapling would be geo-tagged and its geo-location would be shared with the person planting the sapling. “Each sapling will have a ‘special identity’ so that its owner doesn’t get confused. A unique bar code will be issued at the time of planting that would also be tagged with the plant and every week, the picture of the plant would be uploaded in the app for the users to see,” said Purushotam. While a fee of Rs 2,000 is being charged for every sapling in Haridwar, the price of the saplings and their maintenance charges would vary from district to district. (with inputs by Ishita Mishra) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Medical services hit in Dehradun as doct.description: Dehradun: Healthcare service were affected across the city on Monday as private doctors shut their Out-Patient Departments (OPDs) and stayed away from attending patients in response to the nationwide strike called by the Indian Medical Association (IMA) in support of the medicos agitating in West Bengal. While many hospitals cancelled surgeries, others refused to treat regular patients, forcing the district government hospitals to increase their OPD timings to cater to the influx of patients. The private hospitals had decided to keep their OPDs shut from Monday 6 am till Tuesday 6 am. City-based Shri Mahant Indiresh Hospital (SMIH) however didn’t participate in the strike. “Keeping the convenience of patients in mind, we decided not to participate in the strike. All emergency and OPD services ran as usual at our hospital,” said Bhupendra Raturi, PRO, SMIH. Doctors at government hospitals in the city also observed a partial strike. At Government Doon Medical College Hospital (GDMCH), the doctors started OPD at 10 am against the regular timing of 8 am. “Many doctors avoided OPD from 8 am to 10 am on Monday, but a few opted not to take part in the strike. Seeing the heavy influx of patients, I extended the OPD timings. The patients were treated till 3 pm,” said Dr KK Tamta, chief medical superintendent, GDMCH. Meanwhile, the strike caught many patients by surprise. “My mother was complaining of joint pain since Saturday night. I couldn’t take her to a doctor on Sunday as the clinics were closed. I took her to Max Hospital initially, but the OPD was closed. Next day, I also visited private orthopaedics clinics, but they, too, were on strike,” said Vinay Singh, who works at a security agency. The IMA had announced withdrawal of non-essential medical services for 24 hours in support of the striking junior doctors in West Bengal. Speaking to TOI, IMA’s state president Dr BS Judge said that the safety of doctors has been a matter of great concern and it needs to be addressed on priority. “A proper law against assault on doctors has been our long-standing demand. This time, the government must ensure that some strong legal action is taken against all the accused who have hit the doctors in West Bengal,” he added. CM Trivendra Singh Rawat meets Union min.description: HARIDWAR: Chief minister Trivendra Singh Rawat called upon Union forest minister Prakash Javadekar and Union railway minister Piyush Goyal in New Delhi on Monday. The CM urged the forest and environment minister to give permission to Uttarakhand to have rights to divert forest land of up to five hectares for development activities on its own without the need for permission from Centre. He also sought more finances under Compensatory Afforestation Fund Management and Planning Authority (CAMPA), and rights for planning smart city or national games in the area. He also brought the matter of silviculture felling above 1000 meters in Uttarakhand into his notice for better management of forests, citing Forest Research Institute’s (FRI) recommendation for chir pine tree felling and, requested him to provide water cess funds to the tune of Rs 3.25 crore per year as were being given earlier. Rawat also sought permission to conduct afforestation in the degraded land of forest department. While meeting rail minister, CM urged him to grant approval to start new trains in the Kumaon region to improve accessibility. He also reminded the central minister of a proposal of Rs 791.39 crore funds for Roorkee-Deoband rail line for which Uttarakhand will contribute Rs 240 crore. Chamki fever.description: MUZAFFARPUR: The toll in the outbreak of Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) in Bihar rose to 114 on Wednesday with seven more deaths in the endemic zone even as reports came in of children being admitted with similar symptoms in other districts like Samastipur, Banka and Vaishali. Sri Krishna Medical College and Hospital (SKMCH) in Muzaffarpur, where most of the patients have been undergoing treatment since the disease spread, struggled to handle the spate of new admissions with its limited infrastructure. Sources at the hospital said the stream of high-profile visitors, including the chief minister and the Union health minister, was adding to the chaos. The scarcity of beds and doctors continued even as the Bihar State Health Society issued a list of 15 doctors, technicians and nurses deputed by the Union health ministry to assist at the hospital. "All 637 beds, including 30 in the paediatric ICUs, are occupied. We have had to put two kids on one bed to accommodate more children," SKMCH superintendent Sunil Kumar Shahi said. He admitted that there was a shortage of senior resident doctors in every department. "Though there is a shortage, it is inhuman to turn away patients just because we cannot accommodate them. Many of them have come from far-flung villages of north Bihar. Around 40 to 50 new cases of AES have been coming every day, but our resources are very limited." To ease the crisis, a makeshift paediatric ICU with 20 beds and four new ACs was set up on Wednesday. But frequent power cuts hampered the efforts. The Hhospital authorities said 154 children were undergoing treatment for AES at three paediatric ICUs with 10 beds each. In Vaishali, civil surgeon ID Ranjan said 15 suspected cases of AES had been reported from Hajipur. "Several kids have died in the villages there. Some have died in the referral hospital before being diagnosed. Their relatives say they had high fever and convulsions, among other symptoms indicative of AES." At least three of seven infants with AES symptoms admitted to the Sadar hospital in Samastipur were referred to the SKMCH. One of them died on the way. But civil surgeon Siyaram Mishra denied that any AES patient had been admitted at the Sadar hospital. In Banka district, the death of a two-year-old in a village in Katoria block has caused alarm. Muzaffarpur DM Alok Ranjan Ghosh has cancelled the leave of all government employees in the district. "The number of children admitted with AES symptoms since June 1 has gone up to 5,530. Till Wednesday, 187 kids were discharged after treatment while 101 of them are still under the care of the two main medical institutions in the district. The condition of 24 children is critical. All of them are on ventilators," Ghosh said. "A massive awareness campaign has started in all blocks with the help of Jiveeka associates and aanganwadi sevikas and sahayeekas. Executive magistrates have been deployed in every block to monitor the awareness programme, apart from keeping a close vigil on the patients with AES." Neighbouring Ranchi is also in the grip of an AES scare, with anxious parents taking their children to hospitals at the slightest hint of any symptom associated with the disease. Nisha Devi, a mother of two daughters aged six and four, said: "Both my daughters have been running a fever for two days. Though the paediatrician I visited advised rest and prescribed a few medicines, I insisted on complete blood tests for both to rule out AES." Standing in a line with his four-year-old daughter at Ranchi Sadar Hospital, Jagatram, a worker in an electronics shop, looked and sounded worried. "I brought her here because she was running a temperature all night. With so many kids dying in Bihar, I cannot take any risk," said the father of two. District civil surgeon BV Prasad told TOI that the Ranchi administration would release guidelines for AES awareness to quell the panic and confusion. "It is a good thing that parents are alert. Although this means long queues in the paediatric departments, chances of a case going undetected are minimised. We will be releasing a communique informing people about AES and its symptoms. Fever, vomiting and convulsions - all three symptoms are generally connected with AES and parents of small kids experiencing even one of those should consult a doctor," he said. Times ViewLittle children dying or suffering permanent brain damage is always a human tragedy, but when official apathy and neglect contirbute to it, that is criminal dereliction of duty. Bihar has seen these deaths happen year after year even if the numbers have in one year gone down and in another shoot up. Muzaffarpur has been the epicenter. Given those facts, it is just inexcusable that the government has failed so miserably in ensuring the public health set-up is equipped to cope. Grand schemes count for little if they are of no help to poor families losing their little ones. Of course, tackling this disease needs more than just good PHCs or hospitals. As long as malnutrition is rampant, the problem will remain. To root it out, therefore, adequate nutrition is the first step. But that does not preclude effective medical intervention to ensure that the loss of lives is kept to the minimum if not eliminated altogether.(With inputs from Debjani Chakraborty in Ranchi)Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Power cuts follow rain, Doon worst hit.description: DEHRADUN: The Uttarakhand Power Corporation Limited (UPCL) helpline kept buzzing till late night on Monday when heavy rains had lashed the city. Power cuts were reported in many parts of town after Monday’s rains and electricity supply wasn’t properly restored till the next morning. Almost all major areas, including Cross Road, Dilaram Bazar, Karanpur, Rajpur, Raipur and Sahastradhara Road remained without power till Tuesday morning. UPCL officials said that strong winds had felled a number of trees, which damaged a total of 31 poles and created short-circuit in three transformers in Garhwal region. Dehradun was the most affected, with 18 of the damaged poles and all three damaged transformers being from the district. Ramesh Chauhan, a resident of Cross Road said, “Even after (power) supply was restored in our area by Tuesday morning, the voltage was so low that we couldn’t switch on any devices. Calls to the helpline went unanswered many times. Finally when the operator answered, they had no information on when the power would be restored or what had caused the outage.” Even though UPCL managing director BCK Mishra said that all the damages had been repaired and supply restored to normal, power supply was intermittent on Tuesday. Residents complained of frequent power cuts since morning. “In early morning, there were frequent power cuts. Even though the monsoon has not started yet, this is the state of preparedness. Imagine what will happen in July and August,” said Ashish Negi, a resident of Subhash Road. When asked about the discom’s preparedness for monsoon, Mishra said UPCL had made all necessary arrangements and was ready to restore power supply even in far-flung areas. “We have the men and material ready. We have also sent adequate supplies to all the distribution centres across the state and are ready to handle any challenge,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Amit Shah sends commendation letters to.description: Dehradun: Union home minister Amit Shah sent a letter of appreciation to more than 150 full-time state party workers. The letter stressed upon the importance of workers in the party and urged the party members to continue working tirelessly for the party. Commenting on the development, Jyoti Prasad Gairola, state BJP vice president, told TOI, “The commendation letters were posted to the address of all the full-timers roped in for the Lok Sabha elections across the country from Delhi on June 3.” “Receiving a letter of appreciation from Amit Shah was special. I appreciate that he recognized our efforts during the election campaign in Uttarakhand,” said one of the BJP workers who received the letter. It has also been learnt that Shah provided each full-timer with a motorbike, a smartphone, a small honorarium, and free stay in the assembly segment they were campaigning during the elections.
