Battling staff crunch, Corbett says no t.description: Nainital: Burdened with repeated requests from ‘VIPs’ across the country and shortage of staff, the authorities of Corbett Tiger Reserve have issued directions to not allow any special arrangements for anybody seeking favours citing official positions. However, state guests will be an exception to this rule. The order issued by CTR director Sanjiv Chaturvedi recently states, “In the future, such requests are not to be taken cognizance of at all and the same has to be returned immediately, in original, to the office concerned and the matter has to be reported to the higher authorities of such offices for action against them, regarding such abuse of official positions.” It added that the directions should be implemented with immediate effect. In the order, the whistle blower IFS officer said that ‘VIP culture’ is ‘anathema’ to principles of equality. The official also said that the administration has already made elaborate arrangements, accessible by all, for booking of rooms around the reserve in a completely transparent manner through an online portal. According to sources, the reserve is facing acute shortage of staff. At present, there are only 302 staff members working in the reserve as against the sanctioned strength of 461. Out of the 229 posts reserved for forest guards, only 137 have been filled so far. Similarly, only 12 forest rangers are available as against sanctioned 19. Also, one post remains vacant in the place of four class one positions. Sources said that the authorities of the reserve, where day safari and night stays are allowed in its six zones from November 15 to June 15 every year, receive numerous requests from officers, judges, bureaucrats and other VIPs for special services on private visits. “Such practices also put stress on an already overburdened administration, primary duties of which are habitat management and protection works,” added the order. The director said that the state guests entitled to such arrangements on private visits are the President, Prime Minister, Chief Justice of India and Lok Sabha speaker among others. The order states, “Thus, viewed from any angle, such communications and subsequent attempts by the functionaries concerned for these ends are nothing but brazen misuse of official positions/symbols for absolutely private purposes.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .
